p.s: Description of Dactylosporangium roseum sp. nov.
Dactylosporangium roseum (ro'se.um. L. neut. adj. roseum rose colored, referring to the color of the vegetative mycelium)

The formation of finger-shaped sporangia containing motile spores, the absence of true alerial mycelia, and type II cell walls place strain SF-2186T in the genus Dactylosporangium Thiemann et al. (14).
Four species, D. aurantiacum (14), D. thailandense (13, 14), D. matsuzakiense (11), and D. vinaceum (12), have been described previously as species of the genus Dactylosporangium.
We compared strain SF-2186T directly with the type strains of these four previously described species.
No outstanding differences in morphology were apparent among these four type strains and strain SF-2186T, regardless of whether sporangia or spores were compared.

However, strain SF-2186T differs clearly from the other four type strains in its cultural and physiological characteristics, as described below. D. vinaceum produces a wine to deep red diffusible pigment on almost all media used, whereas no obvious diffusible pigment was observed in strain SF-2186T on the same media.
As shown in Table 2, the reverse colors of D. aurantiacum, D. thailandense, and D. matsuzakiense are apricot to orange on oatmeal agar, whereas the reverse of strain SF-2186T is colorless.

On the other hand, strain SF-2186T shows a distinctive rose reverse color on yeast extract-malt extract agar, on inorganic salts-starch agar, and especially on sucrose-yeast extract agar, whereas the other three species do not show such color on these media.
In addition, strain SF-2186T and the other four species differ in some physiological properties, such as starch hydrolysis and utilization of D-mannitol and L-rhamnose (Table 2).
In view of the characteristics described above, strain SF-2186T can be considered a new species of the genus Dactylosporangium, for which we propose the name Dactylosporangium roseum sp. nov.
Strain SF-2186 is the type strain of D. roseum; a culture of this strain has been deposited in the Institute for Fermentation, Osaka, Japan, as strain IFO 14352
